subject: question about the use of a framework change between 3.7 and 3.8
msgSnippet: Hi, following change was introduced (making that 3.8 tests sometimes don t compile in 3.7) : Made the string argument TestCase constructor optional. You can
messageBody:
Hi,

following change was introduced
(making that 3.8 tests sometimes don't compile in 3.7) :

Made the string argument TestCase constructor optional. You can now
delete constructors of the form
"FooTestCase(String name) {
super(name);
}".

What is the best practice now : still using the String argument
constructor ?

Why should you not use the old STring argument constructor ?

I would like to know what the experiences
are of other users regarding this issue.

Thanks for any feedback,
AG
